|spouse=Ann Korner (m. 1972; 2 children) }} 'Sidney Altman' (born May 7, 1939)
is a Canadian American molecular biologist, who is the
Sterling Professor of Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology and
Chemistry at Yale University. In 1989 he shared the Nobel Prize in Chemistry
with Thomas R. Cech for their work on the catalytic properties of RNA.
